intro: Matelea pavonii, commonly known as the velvetleaf mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, often covered in a fine, velvety texture. Matelea pavonii typically grows in moist, sunny habitats such as prairies and woodland edges.
